page.title: 14 Abbots Court Farm.
page.content: The farm is 750 acres in Winterborne Kingston. It got its name because an abbot used to live there. When he died he was buried inside the village church. The farm grows three kinds of cereal crops wheat,barley and oats which are harvested in the summer. There is a computerised dairy with about 140 cows which are milked twice a day by Mike Downes. Other people working there are my dad,Dave who is the manager,Simon, our next door neighbour and ,Andrew, the student. My dad has a very big Ford tractor B registration. He has worked at Abbots Court Farm since he was thirteen. He used to plough with horses when he first went to work there. There are no sheep or pigs.
